description:
Small Groups. Local Expertise. Unique Experiences. That's what we're all about. 
As a locally owned company established by seasoned guides, our passion is showcasing the lesser known aspects of Toronto in intimate groups of 10 or less.

reviews.title: A lot of fun for a big group
text: Saw a lot of new parts of the city we normally wouldnt experience. Sean was wonderful ! Will return again

reviews.title: Dont do it.
text: Really bad biking in Toronto. Very unsafe. Roads are horrible. Traffic is very polluting and dangerous drivers who are pissed stuck in non moving traffic. Oh.  Stupid giant streetcar things which are a menace

reviews.title: Had a great bike tour
text: Had a great bike tour with Sean ..great way to explore, checkout the neighbourhoods and learn more about the city of Toronto. There‚Äôs also no need to have breakfast as you get to sample some typical Toronto cultural snacks including Chinese buns and Jamaican patties - which was a great touch as I wasn‚Äôt aware the tour included food. If you enjoy cycling - this is definitely the tour for you!

reviews.title: Sean was super friendly, knowledgeable, considerate, and timely with his communications,
text: Best tour of Toronto!

This tour was amazing!  Sean is so enthusiastic about his city.  He was very attentive about safety. He had great stories and knew his history.  The food was wonderful. A unique experience.  I highly recommend this experience!

reviews.title: Great way to see Toronto!
text: We had a great time exploring Toronto's different neighborhoods and tasting unique multicultural foods. This is the best way to see Toronto if you're short on time.

reviews.title: Jack is the man!!!!!
text: I travel a lot for work and try to do a bike tour in every city I go. Now I usually don‚Äôt leave reviews but I just had to for this one. THIS IS A MUST DO!!!

Not only did I learn a bunch about the city, I also learned local insights I would have never realized on my own. Also I have to say the snacks chosen were one of a kind! I‚Äôve never had authentic Jamaican food before, an excellent choice for a tour of this nature.
Jack you have a gift with people, all the best and keep in touch!!!!
- L

reviews.title: Nice tour
text: I took my 17 year old son to visit Toronto. I figured he would absolutely love this tour and I was correct. My son loved it.
However as his mother ,I wasn‚Äôt as keen to it. I loved the stops at graffiti alley, the school, old home districts etc., & the food was great!
Sean is very kind and knowledgeable.

The few things  I wasn‚Äôt crazy about was...I felt the tour could have been shorter. We spent too much time with small talk before we started out. I also didn‚Äôt really understand why we stopped in Chinatown. I know it‚Äôs where he grew up but I didn‚Äôt really feel that it was a very interesting street and I didn‚Äôt quite understand why we were there.

I love the Chinese culture but I felt he talked about it too often.  I think he could have skipped Chinatown and gone right to Kensington market and let us spend more time there. That part was too short. Soooo much to see!

His bikes & helmets were clean but I also feel that he may want to address the sanitizing issue in front of his tour group. Before they put on the helmets. Maybe inform the group that they have been wiped or sprayed with sanitizer.
Possibly consider making the tour group wipe down the equipment after they are done using it with disinfecting wipes. Like they do when you go to a gym and take a workout class.
Ex...Helmets,bike seats, hand bars!
Just a thought .
All in all, Sean is a gem and incredibly fun. My son really enjoyed his conversation with him.

reviews.title: Taz Judge Southampton England United Kingdom
text: Sean was a brilliant host. Friendly helpful kind and funny. His knowledge and facts of the city is amazing and kept us engaged not boring at all. His treats were so delicious too. We‚Äôd never of tried those sort of treats otherwise. A definite recommended activity to do. So glad my daughter booked it for us to do. Thank you Sean üëçüëçüëç

reviews.title: Toronto bike tour
text: Amazing tour of the city. Showed us an amazing tour off the beaten trail. Great back and forth while riding and great stories behind all the locations. As an added bonus, he provided snacks that represented the multicultural demographic of toronto. Would recommend to anyone who wants to see a more in-depth toronto!

reviews.title: One of a Kind!
text: Sean is AMAZING! His tour was carefully crafted, unique, and authentic. We got to experience so much more of Toronto because of him! His passion for storytelling, history, and knowledge is truly one of a kind! It was our favorite part of our first trip to Toronto and we recommend him 100%! Great sites, great food, and a great person to spend time with. Book him now! You won‚Äôt regret it!

reviews.title: A great experience for getting to see more of Toronto
text: did the tour at the end of my second week in Toronto and saw more then then first two weeks combined. Great sights, food and company. Well worth the money.

reviews.title: Incredible tour through Toronto!
text: Sean's tour was absolutely amazing! I really had a great time and the food choices were awesome!! Definitely a must!!

reviews.title: Book this tour!
text: We had a great time riding through neighborhoods and spots in Toronto that we wouldn't have found otherwise.  Sean was an amazing guide who is obviously passionate about his hometown, and very outgoing and friendly.  I highly recommend this tour and will be recommending to friends in the future.  Thanks for everything, Sean!

reviews.title: Biking and munching on tasty food cant get better
text: Sean is a great guide to explore Toronto with. We felt very safe biking around the city with him. We particulary like how Sean did not just share general knowledge about places but also personal stories. And it was delightful to learn about different communities by having their foods

reviews.title: Excellent bike tour !!!
text: Wow !  A must do when visiting Toronto. We‚Äôve done "food on foot" tours in other cities but this bike tour is the best. Bikes were comfortable and in great condition. The pace was easy with no hills. We felt safe the whole time. 3 great food stops which were authentic to that part of the city and the other stops were also fantastic especially the graffiti alley. Amazing what you can see on a bike in just 4 hours !  The best part of the tour was Sean. He‚Äôs a wonderful guy that wants to share his love for the city.  Very informative, funny and pleasant to be with. It was a perfect family activity and we were 2 adults and 4 kids (age 13-17). This tour is a must when visiting. Thanks Sean !  We now LOVE Toronto :)

reviews.title: A fantastic experience in the city with a fantastic host!
text: This was an amazing tour that I would definitely recommend to others. The bikes were comfortable, the snacks were multi-cultural and tasty, and I felt like we saw a lot of the city in a short amount of time compared to what it would have been like walking.

Sean was really the best part of the tour though. He‚Äôs informative, funny, accommodating, and a great resource for people visiting his home town of Toronto. A great great tour guide really makes the tour worth the money versus seeing the sights yourself and I really appreciated all of the local recommendations we got from Sean to make our trip to Toronto unique. A++ you will not be disappointed!

reviews.title: Amazing!!
text: Such a nice guy! I had friend from China come and we went on the tour with Sean. So amazing! Definitely recommend!

reviews.title: Under-rated tour, a must do when visiting Toronto
text: Amazing tour to get to know the city! Personal, interactive and super fun! Not only does Sean know most of the ins of the city but super helpful answering questions you might have. A must do tour when visiting Toronto!

reviews.title: Super unique & fun tour!!
text: Sean is an amazing tour guide -- he told us so many interesting stories about the history of Toronto, little quirks of the city, and his own experience growing up in the 6. Since I came back home this past week, I've regurgitated ALL of Sean's funny and unique stories to my friends and coworkers when they asked me about my trip to Toronto. Sean also does a great job making sure everyone is safe on their bikes. We hit some pretty great places in town that were fun, scenic, and yummy. I felt refreshed from the biking afterwards too. HIGHLY recommend no matter if you‚Äôre in Toronto for 1 day or 1 week!

reviews.title: A must do activity in Toronto!
text: My girlfriend and I thoroughly enjoyed the bike tour with Sean. He was very informative about the Toronto area and was also easy to get along with and interested in learning about how the city compared to our home country.
The food we tried was tasty and varied and we visited places which we would not otherwise have experienced.
We would thoroughly recommend this to anyone visiting Toronto - thank you Sean and see you for a cider on our next visit!

reviews.title: Don't leave Toronto without a Sean Bike Tour
text: Toronto is an cool city but after having Sean take you through it, it will be an unforgettable place that you can't wait for the chance to come back to. He will take you through fancy and expensive neighborhoods but even better, he'll show you where the "real" people of Toronto live, eat, and play. These are the areas that tourist want experience but we have no idea if is safe to pull it off. Sean will not only show you many things his city has to offer but he'll make you feel at home while doing so by leading the group and having his partner Randy as the last rider in the group.

This talented young and energetic guide has everything planned to perfection. He is super organized and makes every second you spend with him a learning experience. His charisma and knowledge of the city forces you to pay attention to him throughout the tour so you don't miss the fun and historical details that are unique to Toronto.
If you're looking for a unique, affordable, and unforgettable taste of Toronto, this is your guide.

reviews.title: Best Bike Tour Ever
text: I wanted to get a real feel of Toronto off the tourist grid and decided to take a bike tour with Sean. It was absolutely fabulous. Sean was an awesome tour guide with a great knowledge of funky things to see along the back streets of the city and neighbouring suburbs. He is passionate about his city and the culture and history offering lots of interesting information and facts and figures along the journey. I loved the street art down Graffiti Alley and the changing architecture along the many leafy streets. Our stops for delicious snacks along the way was wonderful and our stop in Kensington Market was awesome.

Sean‚Äôs bikes were terrific, well maintained and very comfortable to ride and he made sure we were safe at all times with plenty of hand signals and advice as we navigated both quiet and busy streets.
Thanks Sean, I had a blast and really enjoyed your company along with the rest of the gang. I highly recommend this tour, it was awesome.

reviews.title: Fun guide, yummy bites and sensational sites!
text: Sean is very knowledgeable about Toronto but what makes him a great guide is his charming, fun and upbeat personality! We had a great time and loved the interesting ethnic food he provided as part of the tour. The bikes are sturdy and comfortable and Sean knows all the routes to keep you away from Toronto's busy streets. I highly recommend this tour! It was a highlight of our vacation in Toronto!

reviews.title: Best decision to see Toronto!
text: Sean is incredible! Funny and knowledgeable. Kept us engaged the whole time. And we saw so much of Toronto. The bites were awesome as well! Highly recommend!

reviews.title: Incredible Tour and Guide!!
text: I cannot more highly recommend Sean and this tour!  He knows so much about the city and happily answered questions both during and after the tour.  The food also complimented the entire experience so well.  Book this tour now!

reviews.title: Fun tour of Toronto neighbourhoods and food hot spots!
text: Really enjoyed the tour - we covered a lot of ground and saw several different sides to Toronto - skyscrapers downtown, food markets, Chinatown, Koreatown, parks, university district, residential areas etc. Everything was well organised and it felt like a breeze to cycle around even though its a big city with busy streets. Our guide Sean made the tour, as he was super enthusiastic about Toronto, had lots of interesting stories, and took time out to chat to everyone as we biked around. Would be a good way to start your time in Toronto, if you want to get a feel for the layout of the city, and discover some of the local hot spots for food and culture. Cheers Sean!

reviews.title: Sean is the man!
text: This tour was  spectacular, I had friends from China come and we all took Sean's tour. If you're looking to get a good idea of what Toronto is like, go with this guy.

reviews.title: Book This Now
text: I had so much fun with Sean. Our group was small and at times I felt like a kid again, pedaling through quiet alleys and smaller streets until we popped up in yet another sightworthy neighborhood. Sean is an expert rider and tour guide, passionate and knowledgable of the history behind everything, also providing his own anecdotes as a child growing up in Chinatown. It‚Äôs clear he enjoys what he does and is very good at it! If you want a glimpse of what a native Toronto bike rider experiences, I absolutely recommend this tour.

reviews.title: He even spoke German!
text: Amazing tour guide! So my bf and I came on this tour as it was highly rated! He took us around areas we wouldn‚Äôt have thought of! The snacks he had us eat were incredible! His tour was a highlight of our trip! He even spoke German to my boyfriend and he appreciated that!

reviews.title: Biking in the city
text: My husband and I enjoyed our tour with Sean. He was very knowledgeable and toured us around some cool places in Toronto we wouldn't have known about. The snacks were super tasty too! Thanks Sean. All the best!

reviews.title: Excellent Experience!
text: You won't find another tour which combines Sean's level of enthusiasm, brilliant food, and insights into off beat spots in the city. Book this experience and you won't regret it!

reviews.title: Great way to see the city!
text: We loved this tour with Sean! We had both been to Toronto before but this was a great way to see the city and go to places we hadn‚Äôt been and would never have found before. Sean was very engaging and a lovely host; the bikes were comfortable and easy to ride. Highly recommend!! üôÇ

reviews.title: Awesome Day
text: We had a great tour with Sean! We recommend this tour very highly if you are interested in seeing the real Toronto, learning about the City, having some great snacks and walking away feeling like you have a new friend in Toronto!

reviews.title: Excellent way to view the city and learn some history
text: I loved Sean‚Äôs tour. It was a great, succinct way to learn about Toronto and sample some delicious snacks. Highly recommended and you definitely don‚Äôt need to be fit to keep up.

reviews.title: An Amazing Bike Tour
text: Sean's bike tour gives you a thorough view of Toronto from the perspective of a native Torontonian. Not only does the bike tour host have extensive experience leading large and small bike tours, he has a keen knowledge of all of Toronto's hot spots. The bites along our route were also delicious and a solid snapshot of Toronto's melting pot of cultures. I've taken many bike tours and this tour by far was one of the best. Sean was super friendly and made the effort to connect with everyone on the bike tour while sharing the cultural significance of each stopping point along the bike tour. Sean also did a great job of following up with the bike tour guests to give us suggestions about great places to dine and visit during our down time in Toronto.

reviews.title: Highly Recommended Toronto Experience!
text: Sean is an amazing host with an arson of knowledge about Toronto‚Äôs history and culture that he passionately shares with you. I‚Äôm a Toronto native and took this tour with my friend who was visiting Canada for the first time. We both thoroughly enjoyed our experience. Sean is the ideal Toronto ambassador for anyone wanting to experience a great overview of the city‚Äôs culture, neighbourhoods and food. There is A LOT to see, learn and taste in Toronto and Sean does an exceptional job encapsulating that into a 4-hour experience. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend anyone other than him to host you around!

reviews.title: I loved the four hours of immersion into Toronto's culture
text: First timer to Toronto, I'm out of my element and Sean and crew brought me into a great experience.  Very personal, adventour-ous, and a deep dive into culture.  Tasty bites along the way.  Street art, contemporary. And a feeling of not being rushed.  They do it like a professional.  So go ahead, book one soon.

reviews.title: A must do for your visit
text: Sean is an amazing host! This tour was so much fun. He was so knowledgeable and taught us so much about the city he loves. He was very personable, so friendly and really involved and engaged everyone in the group. The tour flew by, we had so much fun! It felt relaxed, yet we saw so much! The food was some of our favorites from our entire trip, and we would have never found them without Sean! A must do!

reviews.title: Great time on Toronto Bike Tour
text: Sean does a great job showing you parts of Toronto that a tourist would want to see while connecting personal stories and taking you off the main roads where only a local would know.  I was in town for a meeting alone so I initially had reservations about booking something like this on my own but Sean did a great job in finding connections between the group and did a great job in taking any concerns away.  He has done bike tours for a number of years in multiple countries so he knows what people want to see, ensures you are safe, and is very knowledgeable about the area, history, and cultures.

reviews.title: Best multicultural experience Toronto has to offer!
text: Toronto is built on an extremely diverse, multicultural population and this bike tour gives you the inside scoop on all of it! Sean is an enthusiastic, knowledgeable, down-to-earth guide who is all about giving you a very personal and intimate experience with the plethora of Toronto culture. Sean shows you how the people of Toronto come together and thrive despite their cultural differences. The hot spots he takes you to are places you need to see and places a general tourist or tour would not take you to and explain the way Sean does. His passion for the city and his passion to share its gems and delicious food is beyond worth your time! The tour is great to do at a the beginning of your stay because it sheds light on the many things you can do while you visit! Highly recommend you don't miss out on such an amazing tour with an even better guide!!
